quote: Music makes me high on stage, and that's the truth. It's like being almost addicted to music.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: I see architecture not as Gropius did, as a moral venture, as truth, but as invention, in the same way that poetry or music or painting is invention.
author: Michael Graves

quote: I love music passionately. And because I love it I try to free it from barren traditions that stifle it.
author: Claude Debussy

quote: I firmly disbelieve that one has to be a tortured soul to write good music.
author: P. J. Harvey

quote: It's nice to be able to backtrack and not be embarrassed by the music you used to listen to.
author: Will Oldham

quote: Change is always happening. That's one of the wonderful things about jazz music.
author: Maynard Ferguson

quote: The tango is really a combination of many cultures, though it eventually became the national music of Argentina.
author: Yo-Yo Ma

quote: We do play to our audience. It's very important. You can't create music in a vacuum.
author: Brian May

quote: If you pour some music on whatever's wrong, it'll sure help out.

quote: Music - that's been my education. There's not a day that goes by that I take it for granted.
author: Billie Joe Armstrong

quote: I like music because it's the only invisible art form.

quote: It was amazing and inspiring to see so many people come together through music to aid the great state of Vermont.
author: Trey Anastasio

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

author: Henry Miller

author: Plutarch

author: Ian Anderson

author: Erykah Badu

quote: I mean, just because you're a musician doesn't mean all your ideas are about music. So every once in a while I get an idea about plumbing, I get an idea about city government, and they come the way they come.
author: Jerry Garcia

quote: Music is always a commentary on society.
author: Frank Zappa

author: Fred Durst

author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: Music is the soundtrack of your life.
author: Dick Clark

quote: Every song is like a painting.
author: Dick Dale

author: LeBron James

author: Peter De Vries

quote: I alone of English writers have consciously set myself to make music out of what I may call the sound of sense.
author: Robert Frost

quote: My loathings are simple: stupidity, oppression, crime, cruelty, soft music.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: When a singer truly feels and experiences what the music is all about, the words will automatically ring true.
author: Montserrat Caballe

author: Jim Davis

author: Arthur Rubinstein

quote: A verbal art like poetry is reflective; it stops to think. Music is immediate, it goes on to become.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: There was one man who was interested in the color of music, the connection between light and music, and that was Einstein.
author: Leon Theremin

author: Steve Reich

author: Bela Bartok

quote: Good rock music always tends to be around.
author: Dave Davies

author: Steve Nash

author: Howard Gardner

quote: In 'thinking up' music I usually have some kind of a brass band with wings on it in back of my mind.
author: Charles Ives

quote: My goal is to be one with the music. I just dedicate my whole life to this art.

quote: I mean, there's times to rock and roll, and I love that too. But I think my first love is acoustic music.
author: Graham Nash

author: Claude Debussy

quote: It's about the music and that's it. I'm not an entertainer. But I do entertain people, see what I mean?

author: Dennis Brown

author: Herb Alpert

author: Sun Ra

author: John Philip Sousa

author: Layne Staley

quote: Music is all about wanting to be better at it.
author: Geddy Lee

author: Hanns Eisler

quote: There's an awful lot of resources that can be drawn upon in an improvised music concert.
author: Fred Frith

author: Ben Harper

author: Billy Joel

quote: I grew up listening to a lot of soul music, and a lot of folk music.
author: Katey Sagal

quote: To me history ought to be a source of pleasure. It isn't just part of our civic responsibility. To me it's an enlargement of the experience of being alive, just the way literature or art or music is.
author: David McCullough

quote: I'm quite into listening to music and not doing anything else.
author: Jonny Greenwood

quote: There is a lot of work just in terms of traveling and logistics and people and gear and all that kind of stuff. But I never really have problems playing music. That never seems like work.
author: James Iha

quote: Well, because music is my life and music is not work for me.
author: Gunther Schuller

quote: I'm a big collector of vinyl - I have a record room in my house - and I've always had a huge soundtrack album collection. So what I do, as I'm writing a movie, is go through all those songs, trying to find good songs for fights, or good pieces of music to layer into the film.

quote: No, I do a bunch of things to entertain myself. I paint, I make music, I take photographs.
author: Charlie Hunnam

quote: The only things Mick and I disagree about is the band, the music and what we do.
author: Keith Richards

quote: Drums just always sounded like the most fun part of that good music for me.
author: Levon Helm

quote: My dad took me to all the best rock and punk shows when I was growing up and music has always been a part of my life. So I'm very interested in the music scene and I suppose that's why I've ended up going out with musicians. Dave Pirner is still one of my best friends.

quote: I think that is what film and art and music do they can work as a map of sorts for your feelings.
author: Bruce Springsteen

quote: I'm one of those firm believers that good music will prevail.
author: Pras Michel

quote: I do like what Alicia Keys and John Legend are doing. With their music, you keep your clothes on.

quote: I wasn't interested in writing music that wasn't beautiful for me to listen to.
author: Joanna Newsom

quote: Black music has increased my enjoyment of what I do. It has increased my range, my ability to reach into myself and accept myself.
author: Michael Bolton

quote: For a person as obsessed with music as I am, I always hear a song in the back of my head, all the time, and that usually is my own tune. I've done that all my life.

author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Rock and roll music - the music of freedom frightens people and unleashes all manner of conservative defense mechanisms.
author: Salman Rushdie

quote: When music fails to agree to the ear, to soothe the ear and the heart and the senses, then it has missed the point.
author: Maria Callas

quote: Conductors' careers are made for the most part with 'Romantic' music. 'Classic' music eliminates the conductor we do not remember him in it.
author: Igor Stravinsky

author: Yehudi Menuhin

quote: Music exists for the purpose of growing an admirable heart.
author: Shinichi Suzuki

quote: Napster hijacked our music without asking. They never sought our permission. Our catalog of music simply became available as free downloads on the Napster system.
author: Lars Ulrich

author: Greg Lake

author: Anthony Trollope

quote: I'd love to do my own music for sure. I'd love to have a band.
author: Selena Gomez

quote: Music is in my DNA!
author: Rihanna

quote: I like having my hair and face done, but I'm not going to lose weight because someone tells me to. I make music to be a musician not to be on the cover of Playboy.
author: Adele

quote: I really started writing music to challenge myself, to see what I could write.
author: Amy Winehouse

quote: Thirty-three-years-old, still creating art. It's rage, it's creativity, it's pain, it's hurt, but it's the opportunity to still have my voice get out there through music.
author: Kanye West

quote: I feel like I was the only person who was capable of making this type of music in this type of way. I don't rap like nobody, I don't try to sound like nobody.

quote: I just want to sing, I want to work on my music, I want to make my movies, that's all I want to do.
author: Marc Anthony

quote: That type of autograph, pictures and apparel thievery was not part of what I grew up with. I loved the artists and their music. I would be thrilled to meet them, but the thought of getting a scribble or stealing an article of clothing never occurred or appealed to me.
author: Davey Havok

quote: I am into nature and seeing whales. I went whale-watching, and I was really looking forward to that, but when you see it on TV and you see other programs do it, you're seeing close-ups of these massive creatures, and the music that's added gives you a certain feeling.
author: Karl Pilkington

quote: My first real foreign holiday was my honeymoon 20 years ago, and we went to Bali. It was particularly special for that reason, I enjoyed it very much - I had packed music scores and a practice drum pad, suspecting that I would be completely bored, but actually they remained in my case.
author: Evelyn Glennie

quote: I became a set designer for opera. I'm a great opera buff, I love classical music, and I needed a time-out.
author: Maurice Sendak

quote: You know, for most of its life bluegrass has had this stigma of being all straw hats and hay bales and not necessarily the most sophisticated form of music. Yet you can't help responding to its honesty. It's music that finds its way deep into your soul because it's strings vibrating against wood and nothing else.
author: Alison Krauss

quote: The fact that we elected Obama was a sign that the black struggle inherent in the blues and so much of the music I have loved can triumph.
author: Jack White

quote: I read a lot; fiction and non-fiction are the mediums I find most edifying and inspiring. I watch movies and listen to music and take lots and lots of walks. Nature is a nice reset button for me, it's how I get a lot of thinking done.
author: Carrie Brownstein

quote: My aim is just to make good music every single time.
author: Lil Wayne

quote: Music is my hustle.
author: Pitbull

quote: When I got into music, I wanted to learn guitar just enough to be able to write songs. I wanted to be able to express myself.
author: Chris Daughtry

quote: Our job as producers is to make the music sound as good as possible.
author: David Guetta

quote: Nobody was listening when I learned how to play music. But there's something about being on stage, talking to the audience, looking at them and smiling, that's always been difficult for me. I'm a lot more comfortable now, but there are still moments of awkwardness.
author: Norah Jones

quote: I had to resign myself, many years ago, that I'm not too articulate when it comes to explaining how I feel about things. But my music does it for me, it really does.
author: David Bowie

quote: This music is forever for me. It's the stage thing, that rush moment that you live for. It never lasts, but that's what you live for.
author: Bruce Springsteen

quote: Music should be your escape.
author: Missy Elliott

quote: I've programmed myself musically to come up with love-feeling tracks that are romantic, sexy, but classy, all in one. And that's the challenge. Once I create that music, then the lyrical content starts to come - you know, the stories and things like that.
author: R. Kelly

quote: I didn't want to go out and change anything. I just wanted to make the music that was part of my background, which was rock and blues and hip-hop.
author: Kid Rock

quote: We were raised in an Italian-American household, although we didn't speak Italian in the house. We were very proud of being Italian, and had Italian music, ate Italian food.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: What is music. A passion for colonies not a love of country.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: To have someone to relate to and hopefully enjoy the music and get a positive message out of it, to make the best music that we possibly could, those were the goals.
author: Janet Jackson

quote: I don't know anything about music. In my line you don't have to.
author: Elvis Presley

quote: I love all music. Right now I am loving Josh Grobin and Kelly Clarkson.
author: Kaley Cuoco

quote: It's true, there's a lot of melancholy in my music. I don't know why, I'm not a melancholy person. I've always been drawn to it. Ever since I was a kid, if I had an album I would play the ballads on repeat.
author: Norah Jones

quote: Music is the best means we have of digesting time.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: If anyone can figure out how to balance my celebrity and my dual careers in music and film, it's me. I don't feel frightened; I feel challenged.
author: Jennifer Lopez

quote: Mathematics is, as it were, a sensuous logic, and relates to philosophy as do the arts, music, and plastic art to poetry.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: I think often sadness is a great place to get songs from.
author: Sarah McLachlan

quote: I got obsessed with classical music, I got obsessed with Chopin, with playing the piano.
author: Gary Oldman

quote: Basically, I started singing when I started talking. Music has just been my saving grace my whole life.
author: Mariah Carey

quote: I believe 100 percent in the power and importance of music.
author: James Taylor

quote: The calm mind allows one to connect with the inner self, the Soul, the very source of our being. That's where the music lives. That's where my music comes from.
author: Clarence Clemons

quote: I'm not giving up my history and what I've done in my music because I love it and I'm very proud of it. I just want to open it up for more people.
author: LL Cool J

quote: Hopefully my music is medicine, some type of antidote for something or some kind of explanation or just to feel good.
author: Erykah Badu

quote: One of the hardest things about writing lyrics is to make the lyrics sit on the music in such a way that you're not aware there was a writer there.
author: Stephen Sondheim

quote: It was stumbling on to really the bible of the blues, you know, and a very powerful drug to be introduced to us and I absorbed it totally, and it changed my complete outlook on music.
author: Eric Clapton

quote: I've always loved music, but I never really played anything. After 'Walk the Line' and learning to play guitar, and having that sense of performing, I think that certainly opened the door for me, for music.
author: Joaquin Phoenix

quote: I think all music is a gift from God.
author: Pharrell Williams

quote: I love making music, though. I love playing.
author: Pharrell Williams

quote: Classical music is the kind we keep thinking will turn into a tune.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: There are better ways we can transform this virulent hatred - by living our ideals, the Peace Corps, exchange students, teachers, exporting our music, poetry, blue jeans.
author: Helen Thomas

quote: Please write music like Wagner, only louder.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: This music won't do. There's not enough sarcasm in it.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: I listen to music for emotion and I get zero emotion from rap.
author: Sebastian Bach

quote: I love hip hop music, I make hip hop music.
author: Charlie Hunnam

quote: Do I think all contemporary Christian music is good? No.
author: Amy Grant

quote: I'd rather let the music speak for itself.
author: Serj Tankian

quote: Who hears music feels his solitude peopled at once.
author: Robert Browning

quote: The problem for me, still today, is that I write purely with one dramatic structure and that is the rite of passage. I'm not really skilled in any other. Rock and roll itself can be described as music to accompany the rite of passage.
author: Pete Townshend

quote: I have terrible hearing trouble. I have unwittingly helped to invent and refine a type of music that makes its principal proponents deaf.
author: Pete Townshend

quote: You can't stay the same. If you're a musician and a singer, you have to change, that's the way it works.
author: Van Morrison

quote: I don't feel comfortable doing interviews. My profession is music, and writing songs. That's what I do. I like to do it, but I hate to talk about it.
author: Van Morrison

quote: The '60s was one of the first times the power of music was used by a generation to bind them together.
author: Neil Young

quote: My darlings, if I can't write dark, epic music, I can't live!
author: Amy Lee

quote: I believe that music is a force in itself. It is there and it needs an outlet, a medium. In a way, we are just the medium.
author: Maynard James Keenan

quote: If I could believe the Quakers banned music because church music is so damn bad, I should view them with approval.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: I don't need anybody to market or promote me. If people don't want to hear this music, then it's not for them. You cannot please everybody.
author: Lauryn Hill

quote: I think it takes a lot of trickery to keep up with the media and its perception of you. I don't know if I have it in me most of the time to care. The music is made first, and the interviews or photos to keep it alive come later as a necessary evil, I suppose.
author: Jack White

quote: I have taken taking my music to labels for years, and everyone just thought it was creepy. They thought the images with the music were weird and verging on psychotic.
author: Lana Del Rey

quote: Songs used to be short, then they became longer, and now they're getting shorter. But otherwise, music is about a beat and a message. If the beat gets to the audience, and the message touches them, you've got a hit.
author: Casey Kasem

quote: I don't like rap music at all. I don't think it's music. It's just a beat and rapping.
author: Nina Simone

quote: I don't know why, it's the same reason why you like some music and you don't like others. There's something about it that you like. Ultimately I don't find it's in my best interests to try and analyze it, since it's fundamentally emotional.
author: Jerry Garcia

quote: I think the world is very much embracing this whole concept of musicians going out and playing their instruments and playing music for music as opposed to music that has something to do with some form of image or imagery.
author: Les Claypool

quote: We all love musical architecture there's no doubt about that.
author: Levon Helm

quote: Music really is our daily medicine.
author: Evelyn Glennie

quote: Nobody will ever take Maurice's place, and he'll go on with us and he'll go on our music. He'll go on with us as the Bee Gees, and Maurice will always be with us.
author: Robin Gibb

quote: The more a race is governed by its passions, the less it has acquired the habit of cautious and reasoned argument, the more intense will be its love of music.
author: Stendhal

quote: The Wedding March always reminds me of the music played when soldiers go into battle.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: The real art of conducting consists in transitions.
author: Gustav Mahler

quote: I asked my daughter when she was 16, What's the buzz on the street with the kids? She's going, to be honest, Dad, most of my friends aren't into Kiss. But they've all been told that it's the greatest show on Earth.
author: Ace Frehley

quote: I don't like painting flowers in my music. I like painting guts and pain.
author: Jonathan Davis

quote: Music is the fourth great material want, first food, then clothes, then shelter, then music.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: I suppose, counting back, if the Beatles had been influenced by music in the same length of time ago - you'd have to put that into better English for me, thank you - they would have been like a banjo orchestra. They would have been doing show tunes.
author: Jonny Greenwood

quote: The whole rise of new adult contemporary music and smooth jazz was a nice surprise.
author: Kenny G

quote: I grew up listening to spiritual music, Blind Willie Johnson and folk.
author: Ben Harper

quote: My health is wonderful. I work out. I'm working. Playing music. I have a beautiful wife, a nice home, a nice car, I got money in the bank. I got three beautiful dogs that love me. Like I said, I'm blessed. I survived.
author: Steven Adler

quote: Music is wonderful. Especially if there's some kind of content to it.
author: Debbie Harry

quote: I don't see it in terms of changing things, but rather using language and music as weapons for fighting a mainstream media which is predominately right wing, and loyal to the political framework and its corporate interests.
author: Thom Yorke

quote: It was all about music, about getting your friends to come and see you play. I don't see that same intimacy happening very much today.
author: Layne Staley

quote: I didn't think we would ever make enough money to pay rent by playing music.
author: Gregg Allman

quote: I try to make sure that the Buddhism is more or less implicit in the music rather than explicit.
author: Duncan Sheik

quote: Over the years, music put a weapon in my hand and words in my mouth, it backed me up and shielded me, it shook me and scared me and showed me the way; music opened me up to living and being and feeling.
author: Carrie Brownstein

quote: I listen to all kinds of music - new music, old music, music of my colleagues, everything.
author: Gyorgy Ligeti

quote: I'm 19, I'm a girl, I'm very young, I like all sorts of different things, I like all sorts of different styles of music, I like all sorts of different styles of clothes, I like all sorts of different colors of hair.
author: Joss Stone

quote: Music is a great energizer. It's a language everybody knows.
author: Bill Hicks

quote: You can never get silence anywhere nowadays, have you noticed?
author: Bryan Ferry

quote: Secretly, I wanted to look like Jimi Hendrix, but I could never quite pull it off.
author: Bryan Ferry

quote: But when you get music and words together, that can be a very powerful thing.
author: Bryan Ferry

quote: Sometimes before we make a record I go back and listen to a few. It's equally humbling and uplifting.
author: Michael Stipe

quote: I like the fact that music is more abstract.
author: Bryan Ferry

quote: I was really lucky that I came to puberty at a time when music and politics were completely intertwined.
author: Bob Geldof

quote: Pop changes week to week, month to month. But great music is like literature.
author: Ravi Shankar

quote: The classics are only primitive literature. They belong to the same class as primitive machinery and primitive music and primitive medicine.
author: Stephen Leacock

quote: My father used to sing to me in my mother's womb. I think I can name about any tune in two beats.
author: Yancy Butler

quote: What I try to impart to a musician is to really try to practice the instrument in a really sincere way. Learn as much about music as you possibly can. Learn composition. Study to try to create compositions of your own and put your own personal touch on your music.
author: Roscoe Mitchell

quote: I mix up all styles on my albums because that is what music is about now.
author: David Guetta

quote: I played, like, a year of piano until I learned the 'Pink Panther' theme. That was my goal. Once I was good enough, I quit. Now my music has to have some rock.
author: Jack Black

quote: It is the element I miss in electronic music - no performance, no loving immersion. Maybe that is why I was never particularly drawn to electronic music.
author: Lukas Foss

quote: I'm always going to get more of a charge playing Chicago than I will Duluth or some place like that. Just because of the history and the people there are way more knowledgeable than a lot of other cities. It's an amazing music scene with some great bands and great musicians.
author: Matt Cameron

quote: The people who know nothing about music are the ones always talking about it.
author: Nat King Cole

quote: We learned pretty early on in this band that you can't have snobbery in music.
author: Mike Shinoda

quote: What makes my approach special is that I do different things. I do jazz, blues, country music and so forth. I do them all, like a good utility man.
author: Ray Charles

quote: Learning to read music in Braille and play by ear helped me develop a damn good memory.
author: Ray Charles

quote: Music's staying power is a function of how timeless the lyrics, song and production are.
author: Gary Wright

quote: I've been writing Indian music for a while. Indian music is about Mother Earth, and mine is no exception.
author: Jimmy Carl Black

quote: I'm not really interested in music. Music is just a means of creating a magical state.
author: Robert Fripp

quote: If an apprentice does not hear what a master hears, is then that quality not present in the music? Yes and no. In the world in which the apprentice lives no.
author: Robert Fripp

quote: This band is a real collaboration, and I'm greatful to anybody who can appreciate our music. It doesn't have to be a certain kind of fan or person or anything. I think there's a little bit of something for everybody on this record.
author: Krist Novoselic

quote: Times were changing. Clothes were changing. Morals were changing. We went from romantic loves songs like I used to do to rock 'n roll. Now that has changed to rap. So, there's always a new generation with new music.
author: Bobby Vinton

quote: The music of the Gypsies belongs in the sphere of improvisation rather than in any other, without which it would have no power to exist.
author: Franz Liszt

quote: It is essential to do everything possible to attract young people to opera so they can see that it is not some antiquated art form but a repository of the most glorious music and drama that man has created.
author: Bruce Beresford

quote: I wake up in the morning, I do a little stretching exercises, pick up the horn and play.
author: Herb Alpert

quote: I was growing up listening to Queen. Freddie Mercury threw those incredible melodies into his songs.
author: Gary Cherone

quote: When the music and the characters are flawlessly synchronized, the opera develops an emotional force that movies and plays cannot match.
author: Bruce Beresford

quote: I like when guests come over early and we chop veggies and talk and play music.
author: John Stamos

quote: My music is so often like a lullaby I write to myself to make sense of things I can't tie together, or things I've lost, or things I'll never have.
author: Stephan Jenkins

quote: I think the problem starts with the general appreciation of the music in the larger society.
author: Sonny Rollins

quote: I think its so cool that you can pick up the guitar and create something that didn't exist 5 minutes ago. You can write something that no ones ever heard before. You have music at your fingertips.
author: Michelle Branch

quote: We live in a connected world now. Some find that frightening. If people are downloading our music, they're listening to it. The internet is like radio for us.
author: Jeff Tweedy

quote: Stop trying to treat music like it's a tennis shoe, something to be branded. If the music industry wants to save money, they should take a look at some of their six-figure executive expense accounts. All those lawsuits can't be cheap, either.
author: Jeff Tweedy

quote: Music is very spiritual, it has the power to bring people together.
author: Edgar Winter

quote: We are just fans of music, we are not fans of a specific kind of music. We just happen to be a rock band. Until we explain ourselves, sometimes people don't understand why we limit ourselves to just being a rock band. It's because that is what we like doing.
author: Joe Elliott

quote: I guess a good song is a good song is a good song, ya know.
author: George Thorogood

quote: At the age when Bengali youth almost inevitably writes poetry, I was listening to European classical music.
author: Satyajit Ray

quote: For over ten years or so game music has developed into a very large market.
author: Nobuo Uematsu

quote: Every music - except dance music, which is for dancing, I suppose - is for the spirit of the human being, and not for the body.
author: Klaus Schulze

quote: Music enriches people's lives in the same way paintings and literature do. Everybody deserves that.
author: Victoria Wood

quote: The music is a personal expression, like art. It is something that you like doing that comes from within, and is an expression that comes from God. That is why artists are beautiful and why people who copy are not really artistic.
author: Michael Schenker

quote: When today's generation reads Jack's books or they listen to the music created by some of us, I believe that they see there is a different way of approaching today's life and today's sometimes seeming hopelessness that can provide answers.
author: David Amram

quote: There's nothing like a good cheating song to make me want to run home to be with my wife.
author: Steven Curtis Chapman

quote: I feel very blessed we can still have a career making music.
author: Mike McCready

quote: I was always drawn to Broadway musicals, and obviously composers like Gershwin, Rodgers, Berlin and Porter were writing music that I found wildly impressive.
author: Marvin Hamlisch

quote: There's only two kinds of music I don't like... Country and Western.
author: Bobby Heenan

quote: Music is always changing and the changes are unpredictable.
author: Billy Sheehan

quote: Every now and then, a lot of bands doing the same kind of music will organically sprout up at once.
author: Kathy Valentine

quote: The market didn't define the music the music defined the market.
author: Charlie Hunter

quote: When we were shooting in Shreveport, me and a couple of friends went down to Lafayette, because they had a big Zydeco music festival down there. We spent two days dancing to Zydeco music, eating fried alligator... It was one of the craziest festivals I've ever been to in my life, but I loved it.
author: Alexander Skarsgard

quote: Any good music must be an innovation.
author: Les Baxter

quote: I feel most comfortable keeping versatile when it comes to music genres.
author: Thia Megia

quote: Music continues to remind me that its boundaries are limitless.
author: Haley Reinhart

quote: There's nothing like music to relieve the soul and uplift it.
author: Mickey Hart

quote: I thought the '60s was the most exciting time and the most vital music, and we were really together as one mind then. Then afterwards, the songs and the bad drugs, that took its toll.
author: Mickey Hart

quote: I love music so much I love what I do. I work very hard at being the best musician I can be because I love it.
author: Diana Krall

quote: Music can also be a sensual pleasure, like eating food or sex. But its highest vibration for me is that point of taking us to a real understanding of something in our nature which we can very rarely get at. It is a spiritual state of oneness.
author: Terry Riley

quote: I enjoy trying to inspire myself. I enjoy the artistic side of everything. Music, art, fashion, everything. I just like to be on the cutting edge of it. I'm into designing houses and interior design. I like change. I like creating things out of nothing.
author: Chris Kirkpatrick

quote: True music must repeat the thought and inspirations of the people and the time.
author: George Gershwin

quote: It's amazing to hear, as a voice matures and then starts to decline, what kind of emotion is still conveyed by a really good vocalist.
author: Tom Wopat

quote: You just pick up a chord, go twang, and you're got music.
author: Sid Vicious

quote: When we separate music from life we get art.
author: John Cage

quote: There's a lot of music that sounds like it's literally computer-generated, totally divorced from a guy sitting down at an instrument.
author: Aimee Mann

quote: I find Indian music very funky. I mean it's very soulful, with their own kind of blues. But it's the only other school on the planet that develops improvisation to the high degree that you find in jazz music. So we have a lot of common ground.
author: Mahavishnu John McLaughlin

quote: Drugs, sex, booze, all the stuff that we wanted to do. The problem was that we didn't want to learn the top 40 'cause most of the music was awful and we had this other idea about what we wanted to do.
author: Wayne Kramer

quote: I have tried to make the music a bit easier for them to understand.
author: Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan

quote: I look at you and I write down what I hear.
author: Virgil Thomson

quote: You can have music and it will stand alone by itself, but you can't have a movie without it.
author: Jerry Reed

quote: All music is beautiful.
author: Billy Strayhorn

quote: I was bred and raised in a multi-cultural music background.
author: Coco Lee

quote: I would ditch school if my CD was scratched up or I couldn't get batteries. I wasn't trying to get on the bus and not be listening to music.
author: Schoolboy Q

quote: Sometimes I'll have sections that I'm not quite sure how they fit in the puzzle of a tune, they'll get moved around; what I think was originally a verse ends up becoming the chorus, or what's an intro gets dropped as a hook, things get shifted around a lot.
author: Gotye

quote: A good country song takes a page out of somebody's life and puts it to music.
author: Conway Twitty

quote: I think it is the weak and the young and the minorities that you need to look after to get a healthy creative environment - to get a lot of choices, a lot of different styles of music, a lot experimental stuff that everyone else feeds off.
author: Peter Gabriel

quote: Do not take up music unless you would rather die than not do so.
author: Nadia Boulanger

quote: The whole problem can be stated quite simply by asking, 'Is there a meaning to music?' My answer would be, 'Yes.' And 'Can you state in so many words what the meaning is?' My answer to that would be, 'No.'
author: Aaron Copland

quote: If a literary man puts together two words about music, one of them will be wrong.
author: Aaron Copland

quote: Music's not like becoming a doctor, who can walk into a community and find people who need him.
author: Charlie Byrd

quote: You have the ability to write melodies and to put lyrics that mean something: to speak about life and what people are going through in their every day ups and downs, the good times and the bad times. Country music has always talked about life, I think; that's what I've always loved about it.
author: Jimi Westbrook

quote: Composers shouldn't think too much - it interferes with their plagiarism.
author: Howard Dietz

quote: In America, life is introverted, self-absorbed - and so is their music.
author: Chris Barber

quote: If anyone asks you what kind of music you play, tell him 'pop.' Don't tell him 'rock'n'roll' or they won't even let you in the hotel.
author: Buddy Holly

quote: I spend a lot of time copying saxophone players and trumpet players. Not to say that it is not important to listen to guitar players, but there's so much music out there and so many possibilities. I like anyone who plays any instrument.
author: Bill Frisell

quote: There is no music that can't be used politically, but the motives behind the creation of that music can be non-political.
author: Earle Brown

quote: If our music survives, which I have no doubt it will, then it will because it is good.
author: Jerry Goldsmith

quote: I never presumed that a technique of composition or an idea was so special that just using it would guarantee the quality of the music.
author: Robert Morris

quote: Music is an art that expresses the inexpressible. It rises far above what words can mean or the intelligence define. Its domain is the imponderable and impalpable land of the unconscious.
author: Charles Munch

quote: Emphasis on the common emotive or affective origins of music and words in the first cries of humankind undermines words.
author: Jean Philippe Rameau

quote: Music is at once the product of feeling and knowledge, for it requires from its disciples, composers and performers alike, not only talent and enthusiasm, but also that knowledge and perception which are the result of protracted study and reflection.
author: Alban Berg

quote: The British may not know much about music, but they certainly loves the noise it makes.
author: Richard Baker

quote: The Gershwin legacy is extraordinary because George Gershwin died in 1937, but his music is as fresh and vital today as when he originally created it.
author: Michael Feinstein

quote: Let us never know what old age is. Let us know the happiness time brings, not count the years.
author: Ausonius

quote: Age is a case of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it don't matter.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: I know not age, nor weariness nor defeat.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: Age is something that doesn't matter, unless you are a cheese.
author: Luis Bunuel

quote: Try to keep your soul young and quivering right up to old age.
author: George Sand

quote: Our uniqueness makes us special, makes perception valuable - but it can also make us lonely. This loneliness is different from being 'alone': You can be lonely even surrounded by people. The feeling I'm talking about stems from the sense that we can never fully share the truth of who we are. I experienced this acutely at an early age.
author: Amy Tan

quote: Being confident is the key to life. Don't be afraid to be you! I'm super different from a lot of kids my age with style and personality, and I'm OK with it. And if you are OK with it, everyone else will be, too. Just be yourself.
author: Leo Howard

quote: In our age there is no such thing as 'keeping out of politics.' All issues are political issues, and politics itself is a mass of lies, evasions, folly, hatred and schizophrenia.
author: George Orwell

quote: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Age appears to be best in four things; old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night but rage, rage against the dying of the light.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.
author: Henry Ford

quote: There is a plan and a purpose, a value to every life, no matter what its location, age, gender or disability.
author: Sharron Angle

quote: Youth has no age.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: You can't help getting older, but you don't have to get old.
author: George Burns

quote: To me - old age is always ten years older than I am.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Men are like wine - some turn to vinegar, but the best improve with age.
author: Pope John XXIII

quote: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Marriage is not about age it's about finding the right person.
author: Sophia Bush

quote: Just remember, once you're over the hill you begin to pick up speed.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Forty is the old age of youth fifty the youth of old age.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Old age is like everything else. To make a success of it, you've got to start young.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Old minds are like old horses you must exercise them if you wish to keep them in working order.
author: John Adams

quote: The old believe everything, the middle-aged suspect everything, the young know everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Cherish all your happy moments they make a fine cushion for old age.
author: Booth Tarkington

quote: In this enlightened age, there are few I believe, but what will acknowledge, that slavery as an institution is a moral & political evil in any country. It is useless to expatiate on its disadvantages.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: We are approaching a new age of synthesis. Knowledge cannot be merely a degree or a skill... it demands a broader vision, capabilities in critical thinking and logical deduction without which we cannot have constructive progress.
author: Li Ka-shing

quote: True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: I will never be an old man. To me, old age is always 15 years older than I am.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: When marrying, ask yourself this question: Do you believe that you will be able to converse well with this person into your old age? Everything else in marriage is transitory.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: In age of consumerism and materialism, I traffic in blue sky and colored air.
author: James Turrell

quote: People gossip. People are insecure, so they talk about other people so that they won't be talked about. They point out flaws in other people to make them feel good about themselves. I think at any age or any social class, that's present.
author: Blake Lively

quote: The ruling ideas of each age have ever been the ideas of its ruling class.
author: Karl Marx

quote: No economy can succeed without a high-quality workforce, particularly in an age of globalization and technical change.
author: Ben Bernanke

quote: Youth is a blunder; Manhood a struggle, Old Age a regret.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: My love for ice cream emerged at an early age - and has never left!
author: Ginger Rogers

quote: I strive for perfection, but I'm not perfect. But what I can say is my morals are totally different than any other 24-year-old rapper my age now. I look at life totally different. A whole other aspect. I have different views and morals on life in general. And opinions.
author: ASAP Rocky

quote: What though youth gave love and roses, Age still leaves us friends and wine.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: Every great architect is - necessarily - a great poet. He must be a great original interpreter of his time, his day, his age.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: In youth we learn in age we understand.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Probably the happiest period in life most frequently is in middle age, when the eager passions of youth are cooled, and the infirmities of age not yet begun; as we see that the shadows, which are at morning and evening so large, almost entirely disappear at midday.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Sometimes, people can be extraordinarily judgmental and closed-minded to anyone different or special, which is why it's so hard for young people in this day and age to be comfortable enough in their own skin to not listen to the people picking on them.
author: Ariana Grande

quote: 'Age' is the acceptance of a term of years. But maturity is the glory of years.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Old age and treachery will always beat youth and exuberance.
author: David Mamet

quote: Hesitation increases in relation to risk in equal proportion to age.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: In an age where everything and everyone is linked through networks of glass and air, no one - no business, organization, government agency, country - is an island. We need to do right by all our stakeholders, and that's how you create value for shareholders. And one thing is for sure - no organization can succeed in a world that is failing.
author: Don Tapscott

quote: I'm glad I was born when I was. My time was the golden age of variety. If I were starting out again now, maybe things would happen for me, but it certainly would not be on a variety show with 28 musicians, 12 dancers, two major guest stars, 50 costumes a week by Bob Mackie. The networks just wouldn't spend the money today.
author: Carol Burnett

quote: As I grow older, I pay less attention to what men say. I just watch what they do.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: Responsibility for learning belongs to the student, regardless of age.
author: Robert Martin

quote: Old age is no place for sissies.
author: Bette Davis

quote: When grace is joined with wrinkles, it is adorable. There is an unspeakable dawn in happy old age.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: My mother is Turtle Mountain Chippewa, and she lived on her home reservation. My father taught there. He had just been discharged from the Air Force. He went to school on the GI Bill and got his teaching credentials. He is adventurous - he worked his way through Alaska at age seventeen and paid for his living expenses by winning at the poker table.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: We live in an age where there is a firehose of information, and there is no hierarchy of what is important and what is not. Where the truth is often fashioned through a variety of digital means. Are you your avatar? Who are you in social media? What face do you turn toward the world? How much does it have in common with who you actually are?
author: David Carr

quote: Education is the best provision for old age.
author: Aristotle

quote: Be eccentric now. Don't wait for old age to wear purple.
author: Regina Brett

quote: There is no longer a doubt that women are just as competent as men. Gender differences are guided by nurture, as society treats boys and girls differently from an early age.
author: Naveen Jain

quote: There's a vintage which comes with age and experience.
author: Jon Bon Jovi

quote: With age comes the understanding and appreciation of your most important asset, your health.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: If you live to be one hundred, you've got it made. Very few people die past that age.
author: George Burns

quote: Adults are obsolete children.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: I conclude, therefore, that this star is not some kind of comet or a fiery meteor... but that it is a star shining in the firmament itself one that has never previously been seen before our time, in any age since the beginning of the world.
author: Tycho Brahe

quote: The trick is growing up without growing old.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: A comfortable old age is the reward of a well-spent youth. Instead of its bringing sad and melancholy prospects of decay, it would give us hopes of eternal youth in a better world.
author: Maurice Chevalier

quote: Old age, believe me, is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage, but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.
author: Confucius

quote: If you haven't turned rebel by twenty you've got no heart if you haven't turned establishment by thirty you've got no brains!
author: Kevin Spacey

quote: The finest lesson I've learned with age is that all I need is a small team of comrades who inspire me, try not to judge me, and remind me when I'm judging myself.
author: Lake Bell

quote: Lack of education, old age, bad health or discrimination - these are causes of poverty, and the way to attack it is to go to the root.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: I'm very mature for my age, but I'm also innocent in a lot of ways.
author: Kirsten Dunst

quote: Like a lot of kids, I had a Superman cake or different theme cakes, but then I hit the age where I think my mom thought I was ready for the German chocolate cake that she makes for my dad. Just the sight of that, the taste of that frosting, just reminds me of being at home with my mom and my dad and my sister and my friends.
author: Willie Geist

quote: In every age 'the good old days' were a myth. No one ever thought they were good at the time. For every age has consisted of crises that seemed intolerable to the people who lived through them.
author: Brooks Atkinson

quote: Age is whatever you think it is. You are as old as you think you are.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: People say women shouldn't have long hair over a certain age, but I've never done what everyone says.
author: Jane Seymour

quote: You can wear black at any time. You can wear it at any age. You may wear it for almost any occasion a 'little black frock' is essential to a woman's wardrobe.
author: Christian Dior

quote: I'm happy to report that my inner child is still ageless.
author: James Broughton

quote: When granted many years of life, growing old in age is natural, but growing old with grace is a choice. Growing older with grace is possible for all who will set their hearts and minds on the Giver of grace, the Lord Jesus Christ.
author: Billy Graham

quote: It is true that going out on to the street implies the risk of accidents happening, as they would to any ordinary man or woman. But if the church stays wrapped up in itself, it will age. And if I had to choose between a wounded church that goes out on to the streets and a sick, withdrawn church, I would definitely choose the first one.
author: Pope Francis

quote: Youth is the best time to be rich, and the best time to be poor.
author: Euripides

quote: At the age of 18, I made up my mind to never have another bad day in my life. I dove into a endless sea of gratitude from which I've never emerged.
author: Patch Adams

quote: Looking back, I realise I had to grow up and be responsible at a very tender age.
author: Andie MacDowell

quote: Thirty was so strange for me. I've really had to come to terms with the fact that I am now a walking and talking adult.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: At my age flowers scare me.
author: George Burns

quote: My justification is that most people my age spend a lot of time thinking about what they're going to do for the next five or ten years. The time they spend thinking about their life, I just spend drinking.
author: Amy Winehouse

quote: It is not the young people that degenerate they are not spoiled till those of mature age are already sunk into corruption.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
author: Frank Abagnale

quote: The golden age is before us, not behind us.
author: Simon the Zealot

quote: In the information age, you don't teach philosophy as they did after feudalism. You perform it. If Aristotle were alive today he'd have a talk show.
author: Timothy Leary

quote: Utility is the great idol of the age, to which all powers must do service and all talents swear allegiance.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: As time goes by and you're getting older and stuff like that - getting older sucks. You know, I hear all this crap about, 'Oh, you can age with dignity.' Really?
author: Mickey Rourke

quote: We aren't in an information age, we are in an entertainment age.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: Youth is the spirit of adventure and awakening. It is a time of physical emerging when the body attains the vigor and good health that may ignore the caution of temperance. Youth is a period of timelessness when the horizons of age seem too distant to be noticed.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: Just as we reject racism, sexism, ageism, and heterosexism, we reject speciesism. The species of a sentient being is no more reason to deny the protection of this basic right than race, sex, age, or sexual orientation is a reason to deny membership in the human moral community to other humans.
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: Old age has its pleasures, which, though different, are not less than the pleasures of youth.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: If you age with somebody, you go through so many roles - you're lovers, friends, enemies, colleagues, strangers; you're brother and sister. That's what intimacy is, if you're with your soulmate.
author: Cate Blanchett

quote: Privacy is one of the biggest problems in this new electronic age.
author: Andy Grove

quote: Age is relative. Experience is relative. And I think often intensity is confused with maturity.
author: Laura Marling

quote: My father... removed from Kentucky to... Indiana, in my eighth year... It was a wild region, with many bears and other wild animals still in the woods. There I grew up... Of course when I came of age, I did not know much. Still somehow, I could read, write, and cipher... but that was all.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: There's something unique about the United States, a sense of individual rights and freedoms, and a sense of social and civic responsibility that we contributed to so much of the world. We lost that mission in the 1980s and 1990s, when we entered a gilded age, and the culture of individualism became a culture of avarice.
author: George Hickenlooper

quote: A woman has the age she deserves.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: When we looked at the life cycle in our 40s, we looked to old people for wisdom. At 80, though, we look at other 80-year-olds to see who got wise and who not. Lots of old people don't get wise, but you don't get wise unless you age.
author: Erik Erikson

quote: Scripture is filled with examples of men and women whom God used late in life, often with great impact - men and women who refused to use old age as an excuse to ignore what God wanted them to do.
author: Billy Graham

quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent that is to triumph over old age.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote: Retirement at sixty-five is ridiculous. When I was sixty-five I still had pimples.
author: George Burns

quote: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Irrespective of age, we mourn for those loved and lost. Mourning is one of the deepest expressions of pure love.
author: Russell M. Nelson

quote: It is surprising to notice that even from the earliest age, man finds the greatest satisfaction in feeling independent. The exalting feeling of being sufficient to oneself comes as a revelation.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: I had assumed that I would age with all my friends growing old around me, dying off very gradually one by one. And here was a plague that cut them off so early.
author: Thom Gunn

quote: By the proper intakes of vitamins and other nutrients and by following a few other healthful practices from youth or middle age on, you can, I believe, extend your life and years of well-being by twenty-five or even thirty-five years.
author: Linus Pauling

quote: I don't think of myself as a poor deprived ghetto girl who made good. I think of myself as somebody who from an early age knew I was responsible for myself, and I had to make good.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Our age knows nothing but reaction, and leaps from one extreme to another.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: There are only three things that can kill a farmer: lightning, rolling over in a tractor, and old age.
author: Bill Bryson

quote: Even one voice can be heard loudly all over the world in this day and age.
author: Aung San Suu Kyi

quote: We live in the age of the refugee, the age of the exile.
author: Ariel Dorfman

quote: To resist the frigidity of old age, one must combine the body, the mind, and the heart. And to keep these in parallel vigor one must exercise, study, and love.
author: Alan Bleasdale

quote: Though the Jazz Age continued it became less and less an affair of youth. The sequel was like a children's party taken over by the elders.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: I had just been promoted to the first rugby team. It was a perfect, wonderful coming of age. My brother was already in the team, and my father had come to watch us. We went home, and my father died in front of me. Horribly, in about half an hour. He had a heart attack.
author: Anthony Browne

quote: Old age is the most unexpected of all things that happen to a man.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: Preparation for old age should begin not later than one's teens. A life which is empty of purpose until 65 will not suddenly become filled on retirement.
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Better pass boldly into that other world, in the full glory of some passion, than fade and wither dismally with age.
author: James Joyce

quote: I think it's nice to age gracefully. OK, you lose the youth, a certain stamina and dewy glow, but what you gain on the inside as a human being is wonderful: the wisdom, the acceptance and the peace of mind. It's a fair exchange.
author: Cherie Lunghi

quote: New needs need new techniques. And the modern artists have found new ways and new means of making their statements... the modern painter cannot express this age, the airplane, the atom bomb, the radio, in the old forms of the Renaissance or of any other past culture.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: I have always felt that a woman has the right to treat the subject of her age with ambiguity until, perhaps, she passes into the realm of over ninety. Then it is better she be candid with herself and with the world.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Discrimination due to age is one of the great tragedies of modern life. The desire to work and be useful is what makes life worth living, and to be told your efforts are not needed because you are the wrong age is a crime.
author: Johnny Ball

quote: You can fake your age or mask it, but the passion that moves the characters has to be real.
author: Victoria Abril

quote: Living life at a young age is like being a sponge thrust into the ocean. You absorb what's around you. If you're around people who are supportive and positive, that's how you look at the world.
author: Freddie Prinze, Jr.

quote: Alas, after a certain age every man is responsible for his face.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The great secret that all old people share is that you really haven't changed in seventy or eighty years. Your body changes, but you don't change at all. And that, of course, causes great confusion.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you're aboard, there's nothing you can do.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Surrounding myself with beautiful women keeps me young.
author: Hugh Hefner

quote: In youth we run into difficulties. In old age difficulties run into us.
author: Josh Billings

quote: It is not how old you are, but how you are old.
author: Jules Renard

quote: In youth, the days are short and the years are long. In old age, the years are short and days long.
author: Pope Paul VI

quote: Nobody grows old merely by living a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals. Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
author: Samuel Ullman

quote: Jobs are a centuries-old concept created during the Industrial Revolution. Despite the reality that we're now deep in the Information Age, many people are studying for, or working at, or clinging to the Industrial Age idea of a safe, secure job.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

quote: Age is inevitable. Aging isn't.
author: Marv Levy

quote: Cancer cells are fixed at an age where they are still too young to have learned the rules of the society in which they live. As with so many immature individuals of all living kinds, everything they do is excessive and uncoordinated with the needs or constraints of their neighbors... they are reproductive but not productive.
author: Sherwin B. Nuland

quote: Age is no barrier. It's a limitation you put on your mind.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

quote: The harvest of old age is the recollection and abundance of blessing previously secured.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: I'm at the age where food has taken the place of sex in my life. In fact, I've just had a mirror put over my kitchen table.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Not just in commerce but in the world of ideas too our age is putting on a veritable clearance sale. Everything can be had so dirt cheap that one begins to wonder whether in the end anyone will want to make a bid.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Exposure from a young age to the realities of the world is a super-big thing.
author: Bill Gates

quote: We are all shaped by where we grow up, though that shaping takes different forms. I don't think there's any doubt that coming of age in Winnipeg both opened my eyes and made me hungry - if I can subvert all claims to be a real writer by mixing metaphors like that.
author: Guy Gavriel Kay

quote: If you get to my age in life and nobody thinks well of you, I don't care how big your bank account is, your life is a disaster.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: The goal of my diet-style is eating for optimal health and longevity. What greater benefit could there be than living healthfully and actively into old age with no dependence on medications and almost no risk of heart disease, diabetes or dementia?
author: Joel Fuhrman

quote: The excitement of learning separates youth from old age. As long as you're learning you're not old.
author: Rosalyn S. Yalow

quote: I'm very pleased to be here. Let's face it, at my age I'm very pleased to be anywhere.
author: George Burns

quote: What Youth deemed crystal, Age finds out was dew.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Each age has deemed the new-born year the fittest time for festal cheer.
author: Walter Scott

quote: The biggest disease this day and age is that of people feeling unloved.
author: Princess Diana

quote: Every age yearns for a more beautiful world. The deeper the desperation and the depression about the confusing present, the more intense that yearning.
author: Johan Huizinga

quote: Children who reach the age of eighteen with their entire skills set composed on Nintendo and eating Doritos have been neglected. Their parents neglected to give them the character traits necessary to live successfully.
author: Dave Ramsey

quote: People have to understand one thing: at the age of 18, I arrived at a dream club like Manchester United. It was a dream come true. But, even at that moment, I was thinking about playing in England for some years and then going to play in Spain. Even at that time I was thinking that way, and I always gave 100% everything.
author: Cristiano Ronaldo

quote: There's a lot of women out there, some of whom are my age who've never been married and some who have been married and would like to be married again but think their ship has sailed, and I'm like, 'Oh no, honey, let Miss Niecy show you it is never too late for love!'
author: Niecy Nash

quote: People don't understand being a child star is very hard because first off, to be a child star, you have to be very unique. These kids are talented to be able to do it at such a young age. At the same time, you go through the pressures of bullying and a lot of people not understanding.
author: Romeo Miller

quote: At an early age, my mother gave me this feeling that anything is possible, and I believe that.
author: Howard Schultz

quote: At some point in every person's life, you will need an assisted medical device - whether it's your glasses, your contacts, or as you age and you have a hip replacement or a knee replacement or a pacemaker. The prosthetic generation is all around us.
author: Aimee Mullins

quote: We live in an age when the traditional great subjects - the human form, the landscape, even newer traditions such as abstract expressionism - are daily devalued by commercial art.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: For me at age 11, I had a pair of binoculars and looked up to the moon, and the moon wasn't just bigger, it was better. There were mountains and valleys and craters and shadows. And it came alive.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quote: One of the things you learn in football is that you're only as good as your last outing. I don't like to reflect on what we've done in the past. I'm not a very good storyteller, for one thing. I'd disappoint you. When it's time, I'll talk about the good old days. But it's a sign of old age, reveling in the past.
author: Chuck Noll

quote: The thing I love most about my job is watching people age backward, becoming more lively and energetic as they free themselves from situations that are toxic to their essential selves.
author: Martha Beck

quote: Maybe women get to a certain age and they no longer have a filter they're considered crazy people or something.
author: Michaela Watkins

quote: We're in the age of the series, trilogy, boxed sets.
author: Glen Duncan

quote: I knew that I was loved. And that's such an important thing. And, of course, at such an early age, you take it for granted. Of course your parents love you. Of course Mrs. Hubert across the street loves you and your godmother loves you and your grandparents love you.
author: Jessye Norman

quote: Who would want a face that hasn't seen or lived properly, hasn't got any wrinkles that come with age, experience and laughter? Not me, anyway.
author: Cate Blanchett

quote: If repression has indeed been the fundamental link between power, knowledge, and sexuality since the classical age, it stands to reason that we will not be able to free ourselves from it except at a considerable cost.
author: Michel Foucault

quote: Every work of art is the child of its age and, in many cases, the mother of our emotions. It follows that each period of culture produces an art of its own which can never be repeated.
author: Wassily Kandinsky

quote: Anything you cannot relinquish when it has outlived its usefulness possesses you, and in this materialistic age a great many of us are possessed by our possessions.
author: Peace Pilgrim

quote: Basically, when I went to school in Sri Lanka from age five onward, the classes there were sometimes sorted into a hierarchy of your skin tone. So the fairer-skinned kids sat at the front row, and the darker-skinned kids sat at the back by the poor ones who played out in the street all day long.
author: M.I.A.

quote: What I believe about the young age of the earth comes out of taking the Bible as written. And I've said numerous times over the years that the age of the earth, for example, is not a salvation issue but an authority issue.
author: Ken Ham

quote: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age - as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: I don't feel old. I don't feel anything till noon. That's when it's time for my nap.
author: Bob Hope

quote: We're not in an information age anymore. We're in the information management age.
author: Chris Hardwick

quote: In my youth I stressed freedom, and in my old age I stress order. I have made the great discovery that liberty is a product of order.
author: Will Durant

quote: At twenty years of age the will reigns; at thirty, the wit; and at forty, the judgment.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Bashfulness is an ornament to youth, but a reproach to old age.
author: Aristotle

quote: Old age has deformities enough of its own. It should never add to them the deformity of vice.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: A man growing old becomes a child again.
author: Sophocles

quote: Whether you are just entering the workforce or nearing retirement age, planning for the future is critical.
author: Ron Lewis

quote: Youth is the time of getting, middle age of improving, and old age of spending.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: The most audacious thing I could possibly state in this day and age is that life is worth living. It's worth being bashed against. It's worth getting scarred by. It's worth pouring yourself over every one of its coals.
author: Jeff Buckley

quote: Bad news isn't wine. It doesn't improve with age.
author: Colin Powell

quote: My view is that at a younger age your optimism is more and you have more imagination etc. You have less bias.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quote: We try, we fail, we posture, we aspire, we pontificate - and then we age, shrink, die, and vanish.
author: George Saunders

quote: Kids are naturally gifted at art from a very young age. The problem is when they get older and become self-conscious. The process should always be fun, though.
author: Damien Hirst

quote: In the U.S., the '50s and '60s marked the documentary's golden age, especially at CBS, where pioneering television journalist Edward R. Murrow, immortalised in George Clooney's 'Good Night, and Good Luck,' produced such landmark investigations as the CBS Reports programme 'Hunger in America.'
author: Naomi Wolf

quote: An age is called Dark not because the light fails to shine, but because people refuse to see it.
author: James A. Michener

quote: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have. The older she gets the more interested he is in her.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: The surest sign of age is loneliness.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: To me, old age is always fifteen years older than I am.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Old age comes on suddenly, and not gradually as is thought.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: There's no such thing as old age, there is only sorrow.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: One of the many pleasures of old age is giving things up.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: As long as any adult thinks that he, like the parents and teachers of old, can become introspective, invoking his own youth to understand the youth before him, he is lost.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Whatever poet, orator or sage may say of it, old age is still old age.
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: Let age, not envy, draw wrinkles on thy cheeks.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: I don't believe one grows older. I think that what happens early on in life is that at a certain age one stands still and stagnates.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent - that is to triumph over old age.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: Age is not important unless you're a cheese.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: I think women should start to embrace their age. What's the alternative to getting older? You die. I can't change the day I was born. But I can take care of my skin, my body, my mind, and try to live my life and be happy.
author: Olivia Munn

quote: We've put more effort into helping folks reach old age than into helping them enjoy it.
author: Frank A. Clark

quote: Whenever I go to New York or any European country, they say: 'Nawal, why don't you get a facelift?' I tell them, 'I am proud of my wrinkles. Every wrinkle on my face tells the story of my life. Why should I hide my age?'
author: Nawal El Saadawi

quote: Stone Age. Bronze Age. Iron Age. We define entire epics of humanity by the technology they use.
author: Reed Hastings

quote: No sociologist should think himself too good, even in his old age, to make tens of thousands of quite trivial computations in his head and perhaps for months at a time.
author: Max Weber

quote: I think the thing I miss most in our age is our manners. It sounds so old-fashioned in a way. But even bad people had good manners in the old days, and manners hold a community together, and manners hold a family together; in a way, they hold the world together.
author: Nancy Friday

quote: I think the biggest disease the world suffers from in this day and age is the disease of people feeling unloved. I know that I can give love for a minute, for half an hour, for a day, for a month, but I can give. I am very happy to do that, I want to do that.
author: Princess Diana

quote: Let no one be slow to seek wisdom when he is young nor weary in the search of it when he has grown old. For no age is too early or too late for the health of the soul.
author: Epicurus

quote: As technology advances, it reverses the characteristics of every situation again and again. The age of automation is going to be the age of 'do it yourself.'
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: I've always been intrigued by color and by interesting hair. I was one of those weird little girls doing my own hair at the age of 9. I was, like, getting weird gels and new brushes and cornrow holders. I would tweak and perm at the age of 13.
author: Nicki Minaj

quote: Being healthy is something I learned from a very young age. Looking after yourself on the inside helps with your energy, makes your skin glow, and changes your whole outlook on life.
author: Phoebe Tonkin

quote: Basically, when you get to my age, you'll really measure your success in life by how many of the people you want to have love you actually do love you.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: The nicest thing about coming of age is that I can do whatever I like.
author: Cilla Black

quote: Middle age is when your old classmates are so grey and wrinkled and bald they don't recognize you.
author: Bennett Cerf

quote: Most fears are basic: fear of the dark, fear of going down in the basement, fear of weird sounds, fear that somebody is waiting for you in your closet. Those kinds of things stay with you no matter what age.
author: R. L. Stine

quote: With age comes common sense and wisdom.
author: Nas

quote: Too many U.S. adults have a heart age years older than their real age, increasing their risk of heart disease and stroke. Everybody deserves to be young - or at least not old - at heart.
author: Tom Frieden

quote: It seems this is an age of clever critics who keep bewailing the fact that there are no works worthy of criticism.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Confusion of goals and perfection of means seems, in my opinion, to characterize our age.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Of middle age the best that can be said is that a middle-aged person has likely learned how to have a little fun in spite of his troubles.
author: Don Marquis

quote: I have had so many great moments, but I would have to say that dancing the Swan in 'Swan Lake' was such a unique and passionate experience for me. It was such bloody hard work, even at that very early age, that I would not want to try to replicate it again now.
author: William Kempe

quote: Youth cannot know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Leadership in telecommunications is also essential, since we are now in the age of e-commerce.
author: Michael Oxley

quote: Age is just a number. It's totally irrelevant unless, of course, you happen to be a bottle of wine.
author: Joan Collins

quote: You just never know when you're living in a golden age.
author: Alexander Payne

quote: Old age is a special problem for me because I've never been able to shed the mental image I have of myself - a lad of about 19.
author: E. B. White

quote: This might be the first generation where kids are dying at a younger age than their parents and it's related primarily to the obesity problem.
author: Judy Davis

quote: When I started go-karting at the age of six, I always dreamt of becoming a Formula One driver.
author: Heikki Kovalainen

quote: What's interesting about the shift from an industrial age to a technological age is that we keep inventing new media: movies, records, radio, television, the Internet, and now ebooks - and one of the things that's most interesting about the invention of a new medium is watching it reinvent itself as it penetrates the culture.
author: David Gerrold

quote: I've always been drawn to the Edwardian period in England. To me, it seems like such a fascinating time, when the British Empire was at the height of its powers and the strict mores of the Victorian age were dissipating into the decadence of King Edward's reign.
author: Kevin Kwan

quote: After 3 years, I left the army at the ripe old age of 20, but I'd like to think some of the skills are still with me. I'm great at physical movement; I can still remember Morse code, and perhaps most importantly, I can fold my socks up into little balls with smiley faces.
author: Rhys Darby

quote: Eighteenth-century doctors prescribed sugar pills for nearly everything: heart problems, headache, consumption, labor pains, insanity, old age, and blindness. Hence, the French expression 'like an apothecary without sugar' meant someone in an utterly hopeless situation.
author: Tom Reiss

quote: The charm of history and its enigmatic lesson consist in the fact that, from age to age, nothing changes and yet everything is completely different.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The age of chivalry is past. Bores have succeeded to dragons.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Age puzzles me. I thought it was a quiet time. My seventies were interesting and fairly serene, but my eighties are passionate. I grow more intense as I age.
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: Books were my pass to personal freedom. I learned to read at age three, and soon discovered there was a whole world to conquer that went beyond our farm in Mississippi.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I think age is a very high price to pay for maturity.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: Any young man who is unmarried at the age of twenty one is a menace to the community.
author: Brigham Young

quote: But an old age serene and bright, and lovely as a Lapland night, shall lead thee to thy grave.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: This is the patent age of new inventions for killing bodies, and for saving souls. All propagated with the best intentions.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Middle Age is that perplexing time of life when we hear two voices calling us, one saying, 'Why not?' and the other, 'Why bother?'
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: Old age is an insult. It's like being smacked.
author: Lawrence Durrell

quote: If the nineteenth century was the age of the editorial chair, ours is the century of the psychiatrist's couch.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: Age is not all decay; it is the ripening, the swelling, of the fresh life within, that withers and bursts the husk.
author: George MacDonald

quote: To teach how to live without certainty and yet without being paralysed by hesitation is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can do for those who study it.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Children also have artistic ability, and there is wisdom in there having it! The more helpless they are, the more instructive are the examples they furnish us; and they must be preserved free of corruption from an early age.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Every age has a keyhole to which its eye is pasted.
author: Mary McCarthy

quote: I knew at an early age I wanted to act. Acting was always easy for me. I don't believe in predestination, but I do believe that once you get where ever it is you are going, that is where you were going to be.
author: Morgan Freeman

quote: Thomas Jefferson once said, 'We should never judge a president by his age, only by his works.' And ever since he told me that, I stopped worrying.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Each age tries to form its own conception of the past. Each age writes the history of the past anew with reference to the conditions uppermost in its own time.
author: Frederick Jackson Turner

quote: In every age there has been a stream of popular opinion that has carried all before it, and given a family character, as it were, to the century.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: I saw no African people in the printed and illustrated Sunday school lessons. I began to suspect at this early age that someone had distorted the image of my people. My long search for the true history of African people the world over began.
author: John Henrik Clarke

quote: It's trite to say that the world has gotten smaller in the age of globalization, but my travels have told me that it's wrong to think this means there is some kind of uniform world culture.
author: Norman Spinrad

quote: There's something intrinsically Australian about a bunch of brothers and school friends getting together as a band at a very young age and all pulling together as a band at a very young age and all pulling together as mates to make something happen.
author: Michael Hutchence

quote: According to the National Institute on Drug Abuse, the first use of alcohol typically begins at age 12.
author: Xavier Becerra

quote: Here's my Golden Rule for a tarnished age: Be fair with others, but keep after them until they're fair with you.
author: Alan Alda
